sen.j: 大江嘉言（おおえ・の・よしとき。
sen.e: OE no Yoshitoki

sen.j: ？ － 寛弘6年（1009年）？）は、平安時代中期の歌人。
sen.e: OE no Yoshitoki (year of birth unknown-1009?) was kajin (a waka poet) in the mid-Heian period.
sen.cmt: ウィキペディアの「大江嘉言」には、この文の冒頭に「生年不詳」とあったので、加えて訳しました。上段と合わせて訳しました。
sen.e: OE no Yoshitoki (year of birth unknown-1009?) was kajin (a waka poet) in the mid-Heian period.
OE no Yoshitoki (year of birth unknown - c. 1009) was a waka poet in the mid-Heian period.

sen.j: 父は大江仲宣で、嘉言は大江千古の曾孫にあたる。
sen.e: His father was OE no Nakanobu and his great-grandfather was OE no Chifuru.
His father was OE no Nakanobu and his great-grandfather was OE no Chifuru.
His father was OE no Nakanobu and his great-grandfather was OE no Chifuru.

sen.j: 一時弓削氏を称したこともあるが、後に大江氏に復姓している。
sen.e: Although he once called himself one of the Yuge clan, later he resumed his former surname of OE.
Although he once called himself one of the Yuge clan, later he resumed his former surname of OE.

sen.j: 中古三十六歌仙の一人。
sen.e: He is regarded as one of the medieval 36 Immortal Poets.
He is regarded as one of the medieval 36 Immortal Poets.
He is regarded as one of the Chuko sanjurokkasen (medieval 36 Immortal Poets).
sen.cmt: 中古三十六歌仙 を追加しました。

sen.j: 992年（正暦3年）文章生（もんじょしょう）となり、弾正少忠となった。
sen.e: In 992, he became monjosho (a student of literary studies in the Imperial University) and then Danshoshochu (Judge of Inspection and police ministry).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.cmt: 弾正少忠 補足を一部小文字にしました。

sen.j: 1009年（寛弘6年）対馬守として現地に赴任し同地で没した。
sen.e: In 1009, he went to Tsushima Province as Tsushima no Kami and died there.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

In 1009, he went to Tsushima Province as Tsushima no Kami (Governor of Tsushima Province) and died there.
sen.cmt: 対馬守 補足を追加しました。

sen.j: 歌合に作者として出詠するほか、藤原長能・源道済・能因法師などと交流があった。
sen.e: He participated in Uta awase (poetry competitions) as a poet and interacted with FUJIWARA no Nagato, MINAMOTO no Michinari, Noin Priest and others.
He participated in Uta awase (poetry competitions) as a poet and interacted with FUJIWARA no Nagato, MINAMOTO no Michinari, the priest Noin, and others.
He participated in Uta-awase (poetry competitions) as a poet and interacted with FUJIWARA no Nagato, MINAMOTO no Michinari, the priest Noin, and others.
sen.cmt: Uta-awase とハイフンを追加しました。

sen.j: 「能因集」に嘉言が対馬守として下向する際の贈答歌や、嘉言を追悼する歌が載せられている。
sen.e: "Noin shu" includes Zotoka (poetry exchanged between a man and a woman) in his leaving the capital as Tsushima no Kami and elegies on his death.
"Noin shu" includes Zotoka (poetry exchanged between a man and a woman) about his leaving the capital as Tsushima no Kami and elegies on his death.

sen.j: 「拾遺和歌集」以下の勅撰和歌集に入集。
sen.e: His waka poems were selected for Chokusen wakashu (anthologies of Japanese poetry compiled by Imperial command) when and after "Shui wakashu" (the third imperial anthology) was compiled.
His waka poems were selected for Chokusen wakashu (anthologies of Japanese poetry compiled by Imperial command) starting when "Shui wakashu" (the third imperial anthology) was compiled and onwards.
